title: feat: enable animations when loading the adapter in ListTabFragment.
message:
feat: enable animations when loading the adapter in ListTabFragment.

If a new location arrives, the user will be presented with a snackbar to decide whether or not he wants to update
the data. If the answer is yes, the adapter is then filled with new data. This commit enable that in this process the
animations are enabled. Since now the ui thread doesn't have so much cpu pressure, it is ok to do that.

title: fix: parcelable in PharmacyObjectMap implementation and handling state…
message:
fix: parcelable in PharmacyObjectMap implementation and handling state restoration after app killed by the system.

A bad parcelable implementation was causing  a no good instance state restoration after system kills the app. The variable members of
 FarmaciasCsvBean(parent of PharmacyObjectMap) were not being restored. Apparently on rotation everything was ok, but when android killed the app and tapping again the app icon the problem emerged. There is no need to implement parcelable in child class. Parent class must implement it, and child class must override writeToParcel(), don't forget to call to call super and when passing the parcel into java object do the same. See current implementation of PharmacyObjectMap.

 Fragment without UI and its instance state, a new boolean variable "resurrected" to indicate that the system wanted to restore the
 app state.

title: fix: snackbar now slides up to the correct position and does it behind the bottom navigation.
message:
fix: snackbar now slides up to the correct position and does it behind the bottom navigation.

There was a in incorrect property in activity_main layout. Bottom navigation was using  layout_gravity(from LinearLayout) instead of a relative param to position itself at the bottom of the screen. That way the "snack coordinator" was wong positioned, behind the bottom navigation istead of above.

title: feat:  implement scrolling behavior for AppBarLayout and afterwards quick return…
message:
feat:  implement scrolling behavior for AppBarLayout and afterwards quick return pattern with bottom navigation view.

The initial problem was that in activity_main.xml,  AppBarLayout was "wrapped" by a RelativeLayout. This prevented the scrolling flag set in AppBarLayout to work. One solution is to add that flag also to RelativeLayout or add a CollapsingToolbarLayout. Either alternative was practically the same, since RelativeLayout worked as a FrameLayout because there wasn't aligment or positioning based on the other views. I opted for CollapsingToolbarLayout since it is the standart Android way. Both alternatives provoked a change in the layout of fragment_tab_map(only in this layout) and the bottom margin wasn't taked into account, no matter the value set, causing an overlap of the bottom sheet with the bottom navigation. To solve this issue wrap the bottom sheet inside another CoordinatorLayout and set the margin there.  The implementation of quick return pattern was relatively straightforward, just take into account that now there is no longer a need for a bottom margin in the layouts with a recyclerview.

title: feat: according to Material Design principles, tapping again on the same option…
message:
feat: according to Material Design principles, tapping again on the same option in BottomNavigation causes the RecyclerView to scroll all the way up.
Declare another callback in BottonNavigation class in order to inform  main activity about this "double tapping". Each fragment interested in the event should implement the  Interface MoveListToTop. This way, when receiving the tapping event, main activity look for the appropiate fragment and invoke the method of the this interface.
 There has to be also a custom LayoutManager in order to manage the scroll velocity.

title: fix: Statusbar shadow at the bottom, very annoying effect.
message:
fix: Statusbar shadow at the bottom, very annoying effect.

This happens when altering the elevation of the AppBarLayout and the statusbarColor is set to transparent in styles. Sometimes we can simply delete this line in styles. Others we cannot.
One approach is to change from true to false the following property in CoordnatorLayout: fitsSystemWindows=false. This way we can change the AppBarLayout elevation without impacting on the status bar.

title: fix: back rebound effect( in Swipe functionality ) not showing the content of…
message:
fix: back rebound effect( in Swipe functionality ) not showing the content of itemView appropriately

After invoking notifyItemRangeChanged(in onItemDismiss), the next time there is a swipe, the back rebound effect(don't know where is done, suspect that in onDrawChild because there a calls to this function with dx=1080) force to show incorrect views in RecyclerView item. In order for the views not to shows, change explicitly the visibility of them. The rebound effect normally makes this views invisible, but not if there has been a  notifyItemRangeChanged before.

title: Fixed problem with Loader in MapFragment.
message:
Fixed problem with Loader in MapFragment.
As this fragment is not the default fragment in ViewPager it doen't call onStart until the user switch from list to map fragment. The Loader flows is dependant on the onStart method of the fragment. solution:setUserVisibilityHint(true) in map fragment, so that onStart loads, and thus Loader loads also.
